RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1 1/16M Turf CR: 84. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPIRITUAL KING showed good early foot to set the early pace, had a clear lead nearing the eighth pole and prevailed late under under strong handling. FIERCE AND STRONG tracked the early pace from the inside, made a two wide bid near the quarter to take aim, dug in late and just missed in a game effort. GALILEE dropped back off the early pace, circled up five to six wide through the upper stretch and rallied willingly to the wire. JACK SLYE stalked the early going three deep, raced five wide near the three sixteenths pole and flattened out. MORE THAN A DANCE was off a step slow, raced near the back of the pack early on, raced near the inside past the quarter pole into the upper stretch and had no late rally. BEE MAJOR prompt the early pace two deep from the outside of Spiritual King and faded the final quarter of a mile. LUCID dropped back early, lost ground and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Spiritual King
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, set pace, prevailed,

ENTRY.NAME: Galilee
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 5-6 wide upper stretch, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Lucid
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: More Than a Dance
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, inside 1/4, no rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1 1/16M Turf CR: 93. Claiming Purse 20800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KAZ SUGAR BANK settled off the early going, moved up along the inside around the far turn, shifted three deep to race from the outside of Colbaloaf and surged up to be clear late under steady pressure. COLBALOAF showed good early foot to cross over an set the early pace, ridden along through the far turn, raced well clear near the eighth pole and was wore down late in a willing effort. UNCONQUERED SPIRIT tracked the early leader near the inside down the backstretch, took aim into the upper stretch and was outkicked racing three deep. MR. EINSTEIN was unhurried early on, raced near the inside nearing the quarter pole, angled to race from the outside of foes in the stretch and moved up to improve position. DYNAMITE KARMA stalked the pace three deep down the backstretch, raced four wide in the drive and was even late with no closing run. FRENCH TOAST bumped with Shofar around the first turn, raced with the second flight early, raced near the around the far turn through the stretch and had no late rally. BAVARIA stalked the pace along the inside, ridden along near the three eighths pole and weakened in the drive. SHOFAR was bumped around the first turn, raced four deep down the backstretch and never threatened. COOL COMEDIAN raced three deep mid pack early on and failed to sustain a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Kaz Sugar Bank
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, inside far turn, surged up, 3p

ENTRY.NAME: Cool Comedian
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack 3p, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: French Toast
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped 1st turn, inside upper stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Einstein
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, inside 1/4, angled, moved up, outside

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamite Karma
ENTRY.OWNER: Premier Stable and Brown Jr Donald L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 5F Turf CR: 81. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf c ourse, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRINCESS RUNAWAY dueled to deep from the outside of Made to Hustle and edged clear late to prove best under steady handling. PAGEANT PRINCESS dropped back off the early pace, raced along the inside around the far turn into the upper stretch, angled to race from the outside through the stretch run and closed in belatedly. MADE TO HUSTLE dueled for the early lead along the inside and gave way grudgingly. WEST ABBOTT chased the pace from the outside, raced four deep near three sixteenths pole and flattened out in the drive. ASUE coaxed along early, raced along the inside around the far turn and had no final winning bid. BECKON coaxed along early, raced near the rail past the five sixteenths pole and was even late with no closing run racing four deep. RAINAS ROLLIN raced off the early going, raced from the outside in the lane and lacked a bid. ELL GRAY raced mid pack early, was three to four wide in the drive and lacked a rally. FROSTED WILD RIDE was off slowly, raced four wide into the upper stretch and never threatened. GOOD SOURCE bolted into the far turn and was eased.

ENTRY.NAME: Frosted Wild Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, 4wd upper stretch, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Asue
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed along, inside turn, no final bid

ENTRY.NAME: Pageant Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside upper, angled, belatedly, outside

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Runaway
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2p outside foe, edge clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Rainas Rollin
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, outside lane, lacked bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 100. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 20000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE AUGUST 10, 2022 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRAND WISER stalked the dueling pair, circled up four wide past the quarter pole and drew off to be clear under steady handling. ANNAMATED MOON was void of early speed while racing off the early duel and rallied from the outside of foes racing four wide to be second best. HIS NAME IS SUE dueled two deep from the outside of foe and weakened in the drive. NICE WEATHER dueled for the early lead along the inside and gave way in the stretch run. The five eighths fractional time was unavailable.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 72. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAJUN OCCASION was rated along off the early pace, waited along the inside near the quarter pole, raced near the rail in the stretch and drove clear under strong handling. TRIPLE TITOS dropped back off the early pace, raced three wide between in the stretch, angled in and rallied for the place position. MUTTLEY chased the early pace racing three deep and weakened through the drive. SUNSHINE HARRY was off a step slow, rushed from the inside to se the pace along the rail and was empty the final eighth of a mile. SPINNING MUSICIAN bobbled at the break, raced three to four wide around the far turn and never threatened. BOOK MARKER was void of early speed, raced near the inside and lacked a bid. ROCKIN THE PALACE dropped back off the early going, raced along the inside into the upper stretch and lacked a rally. HE IS BAD vied for the early lead two deep and tired readily.

ENTRY.NAME: Sunshine Harry
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, rushed rail, empty 1/8

ENTRY.NAME: Triple Titos
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3p between, angled rail, rallied place

ENTRY.NAME: Muttley
ENTRY.OWNER: Pewter Stable and Bontempo Renzo A

ENTRY.NAME: Spinning Musician
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled break, 3-4 wide turn, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Book Marker
ENTRY.COMMENT: void of speed, inside, lacked bid

ENTRY.NAME: Rockin the Palace
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside upper stretch, lacked rally

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 54. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSE VALLEY showed good early speed to set the early pace and held gamely to remain safe under steady pressure. MASKED HEROINE dropped back off the early pace, moved up three to four wide around the far turn and got up for the place position while racing from the outside of rivals. LADYNESS settled off the early pace, moved up five wide near the three sixteenths pole and rallied late. IOANNA tracked the early leader two deep and weakened the final eighth of a mile. BUSTIN WIDE OPEN stalked the pace and faded racing four deep. NOWYOUSCAN'TLEAVE settled off the early pace, saved ground and had no rally. CHA CHA CHIQUITA stalked the pace and faded along the in the drive. WARISHA raced mid pack, was done early and eased up on in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Nowyouscan'tleave
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Masked Heroine
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3-4 wide turn, up place, outside

ENTRY.NAME: Rose Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, set pace, held safe, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 10. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $7,000, allowe d 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JACK'S LILLY settled off the early pace, moved up three to four wide around the far turn, surged up late from the far outside and was up under all out pressure. GIA'S FUEGO pressed the early leader two deep, dug in late racing five deep in the stretch and missed in a game effort. TIMELY TRADITION stalked the top pair, raced near the rail in the stretch and finished gamely to the wire. THIS ROUND'S MINE showed good early speed to set the early pace racing just off the inside and faltered a bit the final eighth of a mile. FRANKLY MY DEAR dropped back early to race near the back of the pack, saved ground around the far turn into the upper stretch and lacked a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Jack's Lilly
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, 3-4 wide turn, surged up, outside

ENTRY.NAME: Frankly My Dear
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, inside turn, lacked bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 8 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 10 Allowed 4 l bs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FINISHING TOUCH rated along the inside down the backstretch, angled through the upper stretch to race from the far outside and finished well to get up under strong handling. DESI'S REWARD sprinted clear early on, dug in late and gave way grudgingly. LA NEBLINA stalked the pace three deep, took aim into the upper stretch and was outkicked. CHALCOLITHIC settled off the early going, raced three wide into the upper stretch, angled out through the drive and raced even late. HOP TO A DECISION settled off the early pace, raced five wide near the three sixteenths pole and had no final winning bid. LIL H was forwardly place three deep to lay off the top pair and failed to sustain a bid. ESTA CHUCK was off the early going, swung wide into the upper stretch and had no late rally. TUDOX ROADSTER raced up close early on and tired readily.

ENTRY.NAME: Esta Chuck
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, swung wide upper stretch, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Finishing Touch
ENTRY.OWNER: Tribe Dawg LLC and Kline Thomas

ENTRY.NAME: Chalcolithic
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3p upper stretch, angled out, even

ENTRY.NAME: Lil H
ENTRY.COMMENT: up close, 3p, failed to sustain bid,
